title_en: Welcome to DevRelCon Tokyo 2021!
Working tightly with Dev Rel and Dev Marketing
description_en:
A successful working relationship between engineers and community managers is based on trust, shared goals, and a mutual commitment to herding cats. In this talk, weâ€™ll cover the importance of breaking down silos between your DevRel engineers and product leads to give your community the best content at the right times.

Carol will go over how to partner with your Dev Advocates on upcoming launch opportunities, how we structure different levels of GTM into every piece of content our Dev Advocates put out, and how to build a tight bond of trust through virtual coffee chats, daily video standups, and shared goals.
Interview session w/ Carol Huang will be started soon!.

You'll also learn how you can get into the game and create your own content!

title_en: Rebuilding Trust in Government through Open Source Governance
description_en:
In an uncertain and rapidly changing society, a collaboration between the public and private sectors is essential for the government to provide quality services.
Without the public's trust, innovation will not be born because people will not accept challenges.
The open governance model of open source communities is one way for governments to gain citizens' trust because it is highly transparent and makes the decision-making process visible.
In this session, I will introduce Civic Tech's situation in Japan, focusing on the case of the Tokyo Metropolitan Government's COVID-19 response website.
Interview session w/ Hal Seki will be started soon!.

title_en: It's OK to Burn Out
description_en: While organizing conferences and events for the community is an extremely rewarding experience, we often do not discuss the downsides for leading such activities. In this talk I will share my experience of building a community conference from a few hundred people to over 2100 attendees, and then to be completely burnt out, and finally breaking down. We often avoid admitting that we were broken, but itâ€™s better than harming yourself: Itâ€™s okay to burn out. By sharing this story, I hope to assure you that admitting that you are burnt out, and to walk away from such positions is okay.
Interview session w/ Daisuke Maki will be started soon!.

title_en: Reaching Developers Remotely - Using Twitch for Live Coding and Education
description_en: With global lockdowns, how do you interact with and reach developers? In this talk we look at using Twitch as a platform for live coding and technical education. We look at how it helps both the target audience *and* internal developers, and some tips for increasing engagement.

title_en: Azure Heroes - A new fun way to engage with developer community

title_en: Using Dashboards to Help Manage All Community Channels
description_en: Apache Superset is a top 200 Github project, in terms of stars, and the community lives across Slack, StackOverflow, Github, Reddit, and more. In this talk, I'll discuss how we built useful, action-oriented dashboards to help us support and nurture the project's community across all channels.

description_en: Communication is a required skill and often a responsibility of the devrel team. It gives a chance to be kind and accountable to either side of the community and business. How to become great communication starts from where to do it, when to do it, how to listen to every stakeholder and community.

title_en: Hackathons - Gateway To Collaboration & OpenSource
description_en:
Hackathons are an incredible way to bring your community together to learn new skills, build amazing projects & share ideas.

It's also great way to kickstart the journey with Programming, Collaboration & OpenSource.

With experience of 50+ Hackathons, the session covers everything about Hackathons.

title_en: Defining messaging for your developer targeted product
description_en:
Good messaging is essential if you want your product to stand out amongst everything else that's vying for developer attention.

In this talk, you'll learn how to focus on the essential characteristics of your product and present them in a way that relates to the needs of your target developers.

title_en: Reimagining the future of work for Developers
description_en: To thrive in this unexpected new era, our nation and industries need to be agile enough to respond to volatility in real time. As technology underpins this agile transformation, the role developers need to play is also undergoing a massive shift. Much like the gap between developers and operations teams brought about Devops, its time now for developers to integrate far more tightly with business leadership to help companies navigate the economic turmoil leveraging tech. I'll talk about 5 skills the new developer needs to master beyond tech alone to realize the potential - BizDEv teams, Tech Intensity, Culture of Rapid experimentation, Measuring right and Leading for synergy.
Interview session w/ Annie Mathew will be started soon!.
